content:
Web search results:

[1] "Fully 70% of those ages 18 to 29 say they use the platform, and those shares are statistically the same for those ages 30 to 49 (77%) or ages 50 to 64 (73%). Half of those 65 and older say they use the site - making Facebook and YouTube the two most used platforms among this older population."
URL: https://www.pewresearch.org/internet/2021/04/07/social-media-use-in-2021/

[2] "Social media use by age Chart Data Share Embed % of U.S. adults who say they use at least one social media site, by age 18-29 30-49 50-64 65+ 2006 2008 2010 2012 2014 2016 2018 2020 Note: Respondents who did not give an answer are not shown. Source: Surveys of U.S. adults conducted 2005-2021."
URL: https://www.pewresearch.org/internet/chart/social-media-use-by-age/

[3] "Heres the breakdown by age for American adults in 2021, based on data from Pew Research Center. 18 TO 29 YEARS OLD 30 TO 49 50 TO 64 65 AND OLDER 84% said they used at least one social media site. 81% said they used at least one social media site. 73% said they used at least one social media site. 45% said they used at least one social media site."
URL: https://flowingdata.com/2022/04/13/social-media-usage-by-age/

[4] "Facebook the top social network for Gen X 71% of adults in the Gen X age group use Facebook daily, followed by YouTube (63%) and Instagram (58%). However, this group is spending the most time on YouTube, with 54% spending more than 30 minutes a day on the video site - only 50% spend more than 30 minutes a day on Facebook."
URL: https://toplinefilm.com/blog/most-popular-social-media-by-age-group-2021-research

[5] "Three quarters of all adults ages 50 and older use social media on a regular basis, primarily Facebook, followed by YouTube, Instagram, and LinkedIn. ... Trends. Technology Usage Among Age 50+ Keeps Climbing. By the year 2030, nearly 132 million Americans age 50 and older will spend upwards of $84 billion a year on technology products."
URL: https://www.aarp.org/research/topics/technology/info-2019/2020-technology-trends-older-americans.html

[6] "Nearly 80% of 30- to 49-year-olds and nearly 65% of 50- to 64-year-olds also use social media, as compared to 88% of 18- to 29-year-olds. And while only 37% of those ages 65 and older use social media, their numbers are growing. The Changing Facebook Market According to Pew, Facebook is the most used social media platform, regardless of age."
URL: https://www.waldenu.edu/programs/business/resource/how-age-influences-social-media-preferences

[7] "Many of the marketers we spoke with reported that Facebook was the most useful platform for reaching an older demographic. According to Pew, 62% of internet users ages 65 and older use Facebook ..."
URL: https://www.businessnewsdaily.com/10146-target-older-demographics-social-media.html

[8] "7. Twitter is most popular with people aged between 18 and 29. 42% of people in this age bracket use Twitter, compared to just 27% in the 30-49 bracket, and 18% in the 50-64 age range. Seniors are by far the least likely to use Twitter, with just 7% of US adults aged over 65 on the platform."
URL: https://bloggingwizard.com/social-media-statistics-facts-trends/

[9] "When identifying the most common ways Millennials use social media, the survey found that: : 61% use social to communicate with family, friends and acquaintances. 51% use social to kill time. 47% use social to learn about new trends 43% use social to get breaking news."
URL: https://sproutsocial.com/insights/guides/social-media-use-by-generation/

[10] "The Pew Research Centre found that 40% of those aged 30-49 use social media as a news source, compared with 26% of 50-to-64-year-olds and just 25% of those aged 18-29. Facebook can lay claim to the highest proportion of users browsing for news - 45%. This presents marketers with an opportunity on one hand and a challenge on the other."
URL: https://www.targetinternet.com/resources/how-different-age-groups-are-using-social-media/
Current date: 3/6/2023

Instructions: Using the provided web search results, write a comprehensive reply to the given query. Make sure to cite results using [[number](URL)] notation after the reference. If the provided search results refer to multiple subjects with the same name, write separate answers for each subject.
Query: what is the most trend social media for the age 35-50
